pullRequest.body:
In this file we define the following constructions of `CStarModule`s where `A` denotes a C‚ãÜ-algebra.
Note that for each type `E`, the instance is declared on the type synonym `WithCStarModule E` (with
the notation `C‚ãÜ·µê·µí·µà E`), instead of on `E` itself.

1. `A` as a `CStarModule` over itself.
2. `E √ó F` as a `CStarModule` over `A`, when `E` and `F` are themselves `CStarModule`s over `A`.
3. `Œ† i : Œπ, E i` as a `CStarModule` over `A`, when each `E i` is a `CStarModule` over `A` and `Œπ`
  is a `Fintype`.
4. `E` as a `CStarModule` over `‚ÑÇ`, when `E` is an `InnerProductSpace` over `‚ÑÇ`.

---

- [x] depends on: #15760 
- [x] depends on: #15761 
- [x] depends on: #15763

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

bors merge

Lean code looks alright, and I trust both of you on the math.

bors merge

```suggestion
4. `E` as a `CStarModule` over `‚ÑÇ`, when `E` is an `InnerProductSpace` over `‚ÑÇ`.

```
All the what?
oops, sorry

```suggestion
-- We temporarily disable the uniform space and bornology on `C‚ãÜ·µê·µí·µà A` while proving
-- that those induced by the new norm are equal to the old ones.
attribute [-instance] WithCStarModule.instUniformSpace WithCStarModule.instBornology
attribute [local instance]  CStarModule.normedAddCommGroup
```
and likewise below
Do we need the "aux" on the name?

I would prefer that we keep it since it's referencing the wrong `MetricSpace` structure on `C‚ãÜ·µê·µí·µà (E √ó F)`.

I've gone back and marked all the lemmas in each `Aux` section private for this reason.
I don't understand the comment here, there's no coercion arrow anywhere.
oops, yes, also a result of a previous version before I had the Zulip discussion about defeq abuse, but because I want to be careful here, I'm leaving the `with_reducible_and_instances`
I don't understand this -- it *does* take a `[Norm E]` argument...
sorry this was written from when I had temporarily changed it, before deciding it was a bad idea, and then I failed to catch it because git successfully auto-merged master.

```suggestion
/-! # Constructions of Hilbert C‚ãÜ-modules

```
Could you add an explanation of why this is necessary?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: constructions of Hilbert C‚ãÜ-modules
